title: Goldsmith gauntlets

properties.name: description
properties.value: Goldsmith gauntlets are one of the three possible glove rewards from Family Crest quest, along with Chaos gauntlets and Cooking gauntlets. They can be obtained by bringing the magical steel gauntlets (along with 25,000 coins) to Avan, who can be found in the Al Kharid mine (no cost if the gauntlets are still steel). The message "Avan takes your gauntlets, takes out a small hammer, and pounds them into a slightly new shape, then hands them to you." appears as this happens. The Goldsmith gauntlets increases the experience gained from smelting gold ore into a gold bar, from 22.5 to 56.2 experience — about 2.5 times as much as without the gauntlets.

Goldsmith gauntlets

Weight0.226 kg
Advanced data
Item ID776

Goldsmith gauntlets are one of the three possible glove rewards from Family Crest quest, along with Chaos gauntlets and Cooking gauntlets. They can be obtained by bringing the magical steel gauntlets (along with 25,000 coins) to Avan, who can be found in the Al Kharid mine (no cost if the gauntlets are still steel). The message "Avan takes your gauntlets, takes out a small hammer, and pounds them into a slightly new shape, then hands them to you." appears as this happens. The Goldsmith gauntlets increases the experience gained from smelting gold ore into a gold bar, from 22.5 to 56.2 experience — about 2.5 times as much as without the gauntlets.

Casting the Superheat Item spell on a gold ore while wearing the gauntlets gives 56.2 Smithing experience and 53 Magic experience.

If the gauntlets are lost, they can be re-obtained for no charge from Dimintheis in Varrock. Goldsmith gauntlets are always lost on death and cannot be stored in death storages.

After the mini quest Family Pest has been completed, the player can claim the goldsmith gauntlets from Avan at any time. They will not be charged 25,000 coins for additional pairs, and may own multiple forms of the Family Crest gauntlets simultaneously. They can also be claimed in free-to-play worlds but cannot be equipped in free-to-play.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
18 February 2016
(update)

The item was renamed from "Goldsmith gauntlet" to "Goldsmith gauntlets".

16 April 2015
(update)

The experience boost from goldsmith gauntlets is now correctly applied when using gold ore on a furnace.

12 March 2015
(update)

Goldsmith gauntlets' experience increase is now correctly applied when your Varrock armour smelts two bars at once.

30 August 2005
(update)

The "Drop" option was replaced with a "Destroy" option.

[[File:Goldsmith gauntlets detail.png|left|130px]]
'''Goldsmith gauntlets''' are one of the three possible glove rewards from [[Family Crest]] quest, along with [[Chaos gauntlets]] and [[Cooking gauntlets]]. They can be obtained by bringing the magical [[steel gauntlets]] (along with 25,000 [[coins]]) to [[Avan]], who can be found in the [[Al Kharid mine]] (no cost if the gauntlets are still steel). The message "Avan takes your gauntlets, takes out a small hammer, and pounds them into a slightly new shape, then hands them to you." appears as this happens. The Goldsmith gauntlets increases the experience gained from smelting [[gold ore]] into a [[gold bar]], from 22.5 to 56.2 experience — about 2.5 times as much as without the gauntlets.

Casting the [[Superheat Item|Superheat Item spell]] on a [[gold ore]] while wearing the gauntlets gives 56.2 [[Smithing]] experience and 53 [[Magic]] experience.

If the gauntlets are lost, they can be re-obtained for no charge from [[Dimintheis]] in [[Varrock]]. Goldsmith gauntlets are always lost on death and cannot be stored in death storages.

After the mini quest [[Family Pest]] has been completed, the player can claim the goldsmith gauntlets from [[Avan]] at any time. They will not be charged 25,000 coins for additional pairs, and may own multiple forms of the Family Crest gauntlets simultaneously. They can also be claimed in [[free-to-play]] [[Server|worlds]] but cannot be equipped in free-to-play.
